Set in Thirties London, Ballet Shoes tells the

exhilarating tale of orphans Pauline, Petrova and Posy

Fossil, who are adopted by an eccentric explorer, Gum,

and raised as sisters by his selfless niece. The timeless

and uplifting story revolves around each girl's struggle

to fulfil her dreams: Pauline longs to be an actress,

Petrova yearns to be an aviator, and Posy seems born to

be a ballerina. But when Gum disappears, the money runs

out - and the girls have a fight on their hands. Their

struggle to balance personal ambition with the need to

survive physically, emotionally, and financially, proves

moving and comic by turns.
